instruction: The institution's policy document includes a section titled 'Satisfactory Academic Progress Policy.'
response: Compliant. Section 1 requires the policy to be written and clearly identified as a Satisfactory Academic Progress Policy.

instruction: The SAP policy only applies to students receiving financial aid.
response: Non-compliant. Section 2 requires the policy to apply to every student enrolled in a NACCAS-approved program, regardless of aid.

instruction: Students receive a copy of the SAP policy after enrollment.
response: Non-compliant. Section 3 requires that the policy be provided to applicants prior to enrollment.

instruction: SAP standards differ between part-time and full-time students within the same program.
response: Compliant. Section 4 allows different SAP standards as long as they are applied consistently to all students in a given attendance category and program.

instruction: The SAP policy evaluates both attendance and grades at each evaluation period.
response: Compliant. Section 5 requires both quantitative (e.g., credit hours) and qualitative (e.g., grades) measures, assessed cumulatively at designated evaluation points.

instruction: The institution allows students to take up to 200% of the program length to complete.
response: Non-compliant. Section 6 requires the maximum time frame not exceed 150% of the approved program length in credit hours.

instruction: There is no mention of what happens if a student exceeds the maximum time frame.
response: Non-compliant. Section 7 requires the policy to specify the status of students who exceed the maximum time frame.

instruction: The policy states that taking a leave of absence extends the maximum time frame.
response: Compliant. Section 8 requires this: LOA must extend the contract period and maximum time frame by the number of days taken.

instruction: Academic performance is measured using grades, with project completion noted separately.
response: Compliant. Section 9 requires qualitative factors measurable by grades, projects, or other comparable methods.

instruction: Students must maintain a 65% average to remain in good standing.
response: Non-compliant. Section 10 sets a minimum standard of 70% (or C, or institution's higher requirement).

instruction: The school evaluates SAP once per term but completes reviews two weeks after the term ends.
response: Non-compliant. Section 11 requires evaluations to be completed within 7 school business days of the evaluation point.

instruction: The policy defines successful completion of credit hours as grades of 70% or higher.
response: Compliant. Section 12 requires this calculation method for institutions participating in Title IV.

instruction: A student meeting SAP standards at the last evaluation is considered to be in good standing.
response: Compliant. Section 13 confirms this interpretation.

instruction: The school places students directly on probation without issuing a warning first.
response: Compliant. Section 14 allows probation without prior warning if the policy permits it.

instruction: The SAP policy does not explain how a student can regain SAP status.
response: Non-compliant. Section 15 requires a description of how students can reestablish SAP and/or aid eligibility.

instruction: A student is placed on probation after failing SAP but without appeal or academic plan.
response: Non-compliant. Section 16 requires appeal or an academic plan to justify probation.

instruction: Students can appeal SAP decisions, but the policy doesn't state how or under what conditions.
response: Non-compliant. Section 17 requires the appeal process to be fully described, including reasons, documentation, and how outcomes are recorded.

instruction: The SAP policy does not mention Title IV eligibility after failing SAP.
response: Non-compliant. Section 18 requires the policy to state that students who don't meet SAP lose Title IV eligibility unless they appeal successfully or are on probation.

instruction: Students are informed if SAP evaluations affect their financial aid status.
response: Compliant. Section 19 requires this notification.

instruction: The policy contains no reference to leaves of absence or temporary interruptions.
response: Non-compliant. Section 20 requires reasonable provisions addressing LOAs or temporary interruptions.

instruction: Re-entering students restart their SAP status.
response: Non-compliant. Section 21 requires that students re-enter with the same SAP status as when they left.

instruction: The policy lists how incompletes, withdrawals, and repeats affect SAP.
response: Compliant. Section 22 requires a clear explanation if these are applicable.

instruction: The institution doesn't offer remedial courses or incompletes, and this is stated.
response: Compliant. Section 23 requires a statement if such elements don't apply.

instruction: Transfer credits are not counted in maximum time frame calculations.
response: Non-compliant. Section 24 requires accepted transfer credits to count as both attempted and completed for time frame purposes.

instruction: Students can view their SAP evaluations through the student portal.
response: Compliant. Section 25 requires that students have access to SAP evaluation results.
